findings.title: M1: Selfdestruct early evaluation
findings.description: The selfdestruct instruction does not follow the specification, causing incorrect behavior in functions code, code_size, nonce, storage, code_hash, and valids in state.rs.

findings.title: The emulation of the spl_associated_token_program will not work
findings.description: The condition on the first line of the emulate function causes the wrong functionality due to the upgrade of the spl_associated_token_account crate.

findings.title: L1: Precompiled ecrecover behaves incorrectly
findings.description: The pre-compiled ecrecover contract does not behave according to specification, it returns vec![0_u8; 32] instead of empty bytes on failure and fails to handle input less or more than 128 bytes.

findings.title: W1: Differences in the system program emulation
findings.description: In the SystemInstruction::Transfer emulator, there is no check that the source account (i.e., from field) contains any data.

findings.title: I1: Redundant account check
findings.description: The check whether the passed-in account is the Rent account is redundant as the function solana_program::sysvar::rent::Rent::from_account_info already checks it, so there is no need to do this check explicitly.

findings.title: I2: Unnecessary owner check
findings.description: The EvmInstruction::CreateAccountV02 instruction checks if the passed-in code account belongs to the evm_loader program, but this check is unnecessary as the instruction writes to this account and only the owner program can modify the account's data.

findings.title: I3: Unnecessary instruction argument
findings.description: In the CreateAccountV02 instruction, there is no need to send a bump_seed as the find_program_address function calculates the bump. So the calculated bump can be used directly without needing to pass in the bump.

findings.title: I4: Unnecessary holder owner validation
findings.description: There is no need to validate the owner of a holder account in the TransactionStepFromAccount instruction as it will be checked in the State::new function, resulting in unnecessary double check of ownership.
